name: FactureAPI
description: FactureAPI allows sending PDF invoices to your customers with a really simple API. It can be used with No-Code tools such as Zapier or integrated in an existing application. Invoices are archived and can be exported when needed.

name: Waycom – Technician App
description: Waycom is a Telecommunications Company dedicated to the retail market. I created a new version of the web app used by on-site technicians. This app delivers instructions to the technician based on the customer and allows them to report the status of their work.

name: Orvéa
description: Orvéa is a company offering Site Facilities services. I built their public website using Gatsby, which generates static HTML pages from a React project. Content for the blog is pulled from the Prismic CMS, allowing the client to update the site.

name: Store Badge
description: Store Badge displays App Store and/or Google Play badges based on the browser. It is available as a snippet or a React component. This saves valuable screen space on mobile devices for a choice that can be easily done by the machine.

name: Pswd.app
description: Pswd.app is a password manager in your browser created by @jsmrcaga. I helped getting it ready for public launch, which included some UI tweaks as well as online promotion. It uses Blockstack's blockchain technology to encrypt all your passwords directly in your browser. No sensitive data is ever transmitted online.

name: LastMX
description: We created LastMX with Thomas Recouvreux to allow creation of unique aliases that redirect to the user's personal email address. The real address is never disclosed and send/receive are supported.

name: Aristide Collection
description: I worked on improving the Aristide ecommerce website, with an updated design by Bonjour Paris. This included CSS animations and some innovative navigation elements, all built on top of the existing technical stack.

name: Fotokorner
description: Fotokorner allows professional photographers to expose their porfolio online. It can also be used to send galleries to clients. Photographs are shown in a pleasant grid and prints can be ordered directly.

name: Cheerswipe
description: Cheerswipe was created for the Makers Festival 'API Edition'. It uses Product Hunt's GraphQL API to display public maker goals in a card like UI and allows cheering them by swiping! It was runner-up in the Mobile Apps category.

name: Location Diary
description: Location Diary was created for the Blockstack App Mining constest. It allows users to record their location history in a decentralized storage backed by blockchain.

name: Buda Gallery
description: I created this app as I couldn't find an easy way to share my travel pictures with friends and family. Buda Gallery is extremely simple: visit the site, upload your pictures and you immediately get a link to share it. That's all :)

name: Waycom – Project Management App
description: Waycom is a Telecommunications Company dedicated to the retail market. I developed the fronted of an internal Project Management tool to monitor deployments. Projects with large number of sites required innovative ways of displaying data.

name: Weezevent – Head of Product
description: After launching two products successfully, I was appointed as Head of Product and built a product team starting from scratch. This involved recruting 5 Product Managers and setting up multiple processes impacting all services in the company.

name: Weezevent – WeezPay
description: With the two friends from payutc, we created a unique cashless payment and worked with Weezevent to tailor it for the events industry. This solution is now a leader on the French market and going abroad. I worked on many different tasks, from front-end development to accounting, while also designing custom cases for our devices.

name: Weezevent – WeezAccess
description: I developed B2B applications on iOS. The access control app runs on iPod Touch with a Linea Pro barcode. I upgraded the app to the latest standards and made it more resilient to network issues. The POS app runs on iPad and includes a customized OpenWRT router to print to USB thermal printers.

name: Amadeus – Mobile Boarding
description: This application allows airplane boarding using Windows Mobile devices with built-in barcode readers. I replaced SOAP Web Services by a dedicated JSON-based protocol to improve performance and allow deployment of the app to customers. This included creating a new C++ backend and updating the C# client.

name: payutc
description: payutc is an electronic payment system that has been setup for all the Student Organizations at UTC. It allows student to top-up their account online using their Credit Card and then use the money in organizations by presenting their RFID student card. I initiated this project with two other students and participated on various launch tasks.

name: SiMDE
description: SiMDE is an organisation at UTC offering various IT services to other organisations. This includes web hosting, email, mailing lists or Active Directory. I was a sysadmin at SiMDE and participated in building a new architecture using OpenVZ containers.

name: Etuville - Ticketing System
description: Etuville sets up a party with more than 2800 participants every year. During the 2011 edition, I was in charge of creating a new ticketing system, which allowed guests to buy their ticket online and print it from a generated PDF with a barcode. Tickets were then checked at the entrance of the event using a custom software.

name: UTC Student Organizations Homepage
description: This homepage is used by more than 100 student organisations at UTC to communicate with all the students through articles or events. This project uses the symfony framework and involved more than 10 developers.

name: Hanzi Training
description: I designed this Facebook game during my 6-month stay in Shanghai. It helps practicing your Chinese characters by displaying you words and asking for their pinyin notation. This game was also published for the BlackBerry Playbook tablet, under the name Chinese Characters.

name: UTCoupe
description: UTCoupe is the team from UTC participating in the French Cup of Robotics. At UTCoupe, I developed software and electronics for an autonomous robot entering the competition. I was also the team leader during two years. In 2012, the team was ranked 18th out of 170.

name: Le Polar
description: Le Polar is a student organisation at UTC, offering services such as printing (from A4 to A0) as well as resale of computer accessories, stationery… At Le Polar, I participated in migrating various software components to one centralized website: accounting, point of sale, inventory…

name: My Mobile Site
description: In 2008, Nokia developed a Mobile Web Server running on Symbian smartphones, exposing some of the phone's features to the web. I wrote a facebook application allowing interaction with this software: viewing phone location, sending messages to the phone, displaying pictures on the phone...

name: Graphisme.tk
description: graphisme.tk was one of my first public websites. The project was created in collaboration with a web designer met on the Internet. My task was to write the HTML and CSS using Photoshop files, as well as the PHP/MySQL allowing the website to run and be edited dynamically.
